metadata.titel_preek: A New World Not under Threat

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The displacement of an 'old kingdom' of fear and greed by a 'new world' of generosity and neighborliness through the ministry of Jesus and the recruitment of followers.

tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus arrives in Galilee... to make a stunning declaration
Jesus is the recruitment officer for the new world
Jesus will perform the new world that the creator has always intended

object.identificatie: The New World / Kingdom of God (Sociopolitical and economic arrangement)
tekstueel_bewijs: new sociopolitical, economic arrangements of power and resources
reality arranged according to God’s good mercy
God makes a huge promise and announces a new resolve
God must keep God’s promise of a safe world

ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as a potential recruit (Subject-in-waiting).

tekstueel_bewijs: I want company in the project
Jesus is looking for a few good men... to join the enterprise
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Sender/Validator, Jesus is the primary Subject.

tegenstander.identificatie: The Roman Empire / Systems of Greed and Anxiety
tekstueel_bewijs: the Roman Empire with all of its greed, anxiety, and violence
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is framed as a sociopolitical 'regime' rather than an ontological power like Sin or Death.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The hearer's process of 'signing on' and 'relinquishing' the old world during Lent.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Membership in the new world / Ethical action
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon fluctuates between the Kingdom being a 'gift' (Noah) and a 'project' that requires human recruitment to be 'performed'.

voorbeelden_mens_subject: We can reflect on our membership
Sign on for the new world

voorbeelden: We cannot duck his demanding imperatives
Jesus is looking for a few good men
signing on for the new world
Lent is time to sort these matters out
Make me to know your ways
we are free and ready to act differently

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes the obligation (Devoir) and the recruitment of the will (Vouloir). It assumes that once the hearer 'signs on,' they possess the power (Pouvoir) to perform the new world.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in 'signing on' to the new regime's ethics.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: S2 is treated as a sociopolitical choice rather than an inescapable condition.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While using the language of 'Gospel news,' the sermon's engine is 'Recruitment.' The Kingdom is presented as a sociopolitical project that Jesus starts and humans must complete/perform.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus is the recruitment officer for the new world.
God will be well pleased with all those who follow him.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God makes a covenant... that never again will there be such destruction.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Jesus is the 'Point Person' or model for the new world's performance.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Jesus is not the recruitment officer but the one who has already conquered the 'Old Kingdom' on behalf of the helpless.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to perform; Lent as a 'situation room' for decision-making.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Synergism: God starts the process, but its realization depends on human 'signing on'.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon struggles to reconcile the 'unconditional promise' to Noah with the 'demanding imperative' of Jesus.
spanning_punten: The Kingdom is 'at hand' (present reality) vs. 'Jesus is looking for company' (future project).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus will perform the new world... God will be well pleased with all those who follow him.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The hearer is expected to find the 'Pouvoir' (power) within their own resolve/loyalty.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is framed as 'bad choices' and 'anxiety' rather than a dead-end state.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon shifts the Subject role from God (in the Noah section) to the Hearer (in the Lent section), turning the Gospel into a recruitment drive.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is the subject of 'displacing' the old world.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make Jesus the Subject of the displacement; the hearer is the Receiver of the new world.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'We can reflect on our membership,' use 'Christ has released you from your membership in the kingdom of fear.'

identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Hearer as 'Lepers, blind, and messed up people' (Receivers).
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Focus on the fact that the new world comes *to* us while we are still in the old kingdom.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Emphasize that the Spirit gives the power to follow, rather than just demanding the following.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Recognize the 'Old Kingdom' as a power we cannot escape by 'signing' a new contract.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: If the opponent is just 'bad habits,' we don't need a Savior, just a coach.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Proclaim the New World as an accomplished fact in Christ, then invite the response as a fruit of that reality.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon has a strong social conscience, but it risks turning the Gospel into a 'to-do' list for social activists rather than a 'done' list of God's grace.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the sermon is persuasive and urgent; semiotically, it is anthropocentric.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis correctly identifies the Kingdom, but the actantial structure misplaces the 'who' of the action.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that 'Jesus' is used as a label for a human ethical project rather than a divine actor.

volledige_subject_lijst: Jesus (arrives, declares, meets, touches, feeds, forgives, calls)
God (promises, announces, posits, jump-started, is pleased)
We (reflect, ask, commit, use, sign on, relinquish)
appendices.notities: The sermon's conclusion ('God will be well pleased with all those who follow') creates a conditional grace that undermines the Noahic covenant mentioned earlier.
